textAfterTable: Species attributes Migratory status full migrant Forest dependency Does not normally occur in forest Land mass type   Average mass 40.6 g Distribution   Estimate Data quality Extent of Occurrence breeding/resident (km2) 9,880,000 medium Extent of Occurrence non-breeding (km2) 17,900,000 medium Number of locations - Fragmentation - Population & trend   Estimate Data quality Derivation Year of estimate No. of mature individuals Unknown not applicable Not Applicable 0 Population trend Increasing - Number of subpopulations - - - Largest subpopulation - - - Generation length (yrs) 5.6 - - - Population justification: The global population size has not been quantified, but the species is described as common to abundant (Gibbs et al. 2001). Trend justification: The population is suspected to be increasing in abundance and expanding its range in, for example, Israel and Arabia, since the mid-1970's (del Hoyo et al. 1997).
